# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's how you can define this function in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```
This function first converts the input string to lower case and then strips any leading or trailing whitespaces using `strip`. Next, it uses a regular expression to replace all spaces (`\s`) and hyphens (`-`) with underscores. The resulting cleaned column name is then returned.
